headline.main: Ventilation as Influencing Health and Longevity.; LECTURE BY MR. E.Y. ROBBINS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. E.Y. ROBBINS delivered the second of his course of lectures on "Sanitary Science," at Cooper Institute last evening. His subject was "Ventilation as Influencing Health and Longevity." He commenced by saying that air was the prime necessary of life; that we could live more days without food than we could minutes without air.

headline.main: THE NEW ARCTIC EXPEDITION.; Dr. Haryes' Proposed Exploration of the Polar Sea. MEETING OF THE GEOGRAPHICAL AND STATISTICAL SOCIETY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Lecture-room of the New-York Historical Society was crowded beyond measure last night by a meeting of those who take an interest in the project of Dr. HAYES (who was one of Dr. KANE'S companions when the latter undertook his famous expedition to the frozen zone in search of Sir JOHN FRANKLIN) to revisit those icy regions, and make an effort to penetrate through the Arctic Sea to the North Pole.
